author: ForestMenOfEndor
title: The green T.Rex and a special print elevate an otherwise forgettable 4+ set
review:
First things first, this is a 4+ set with large pieces and a dinosaur, so throw PPP out the window. Otherwise, one would quickly conclude that this set is drastically overpriced. However....

I purchased this set for my son's birthday, as he is a huge fan of the Jurassic Park/World series and wants every LEGO JP/W set ever created. We now have 4 versions of the moulded T.Rex, and this green one is by far my favourite. I grew up in an era of scientific inaccuracies, and my brain says that dinosaurs should be green. It's almost worth the price of admission alone.

But the real star of the show, and the reason why I might have to buy a second copy of this "overpriced" set (or at least turn to Bricklink), are the three printed 2x2 round tiles with the "U.S. Forest Service, Department of the Interior" logos. They are glorious, and they are just what I need to complete some MOCs of old Forest Service vehicles in their unique green liveries. I don't think that I've ever seen an official (U.S.) agency logo in a LEGO set before, and this is the one that I would have wished for above any other (as someone who works in conservation and who has spent many months traipsing about our federal forests).

In conclusion, the build "experience" is "meh" and the "volume of stuff" doesn't seem worth $50, the minifigures are ok (you get Zia, yet another Owen, and a Forest Service employee with a generic uniform), and the subject matter doesn't break any new ground. I imagine that many people will happily skip this set. BUT. As I've mentioned several times, there is just enough awesome here that I'm glad my son owns it, and I'm actually tempted to buy a second copy for myself.

This 4+ set gets a "4" rating, and I'm ok with that.
